item.title: Global COVID-19 cases reach more than 18.8M, death toll at 708,236 with 11.1M recoveries
item.description: At least 18,843,580 cases have been registered in 196 countries and territories. Of these, at least 11,159,300 are now considered recovered at least 708,236 people have died since the outbreak emerged in China last December, according to a tally from official sources compiled by AFP at 1100 GMT on Thursday.

item.title: Malaysia arrests ex-finance minister on corruption charges
item.description: Malaysia's former finance minister Lim Guan Eng was arrested on Thursday in connection with corruption allegations over a $1.5 billion undersea tunnel project, state news agency Bernama reported.

item.title: Global recovery will come faster if COVID vaccine available to all - WHO chief
item.description: Economic recovery around the world could come faster if any COVID-19 vaccine is made available to all as a public good, World Health Organization (WHO) Director General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said on Thursday.

item.title: Seaman na napurnada ang muling pagsampa sa barko, nakabawi sa negosyong ginagamitan ng lupa
item.description: Sa loob ng 27 na taon, ang dagat ang naging buhay ng 54-anyos na si Ely Feria bilang isang seaman. Pero nang mapurnada ang muli sana niyang pagsampa ng barko dahil sa COVID-19 pandemic, sa negosyong may lupa siya nakabangon at nakabawi.

item.title: PhilHealth members worry about looming bankruptcy
item.description: Several Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) members are worried that the looming bankruptcy that the agency is facing, according to Maki Pulido s report on “24 Oras” on Thursday.

item.title: Philippines now has 100 COVID-19 testing labs
item.description: There are now 100 laboratories nationwide licensed to conduct independent testing for the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19), the Department of Health (DOH) said Thursday.

item.title: Pinoys turn to social media for primary care amid pandemic --health expert
item.description: "These are alternative sources: Facebook, Twitter, and Google. And when things get really bad, we go to a hospital and we are seeing this right now in the COVID pandemic where people get a lot of their treatments, prevention, and their actions based on social media which is very unreliable," Dr. Antonio Miguel Dans said.

item.title: Hong Kong press club says journalists hitting unusual visa issues
item.description: Hong Kong's foreign press club said Thursday that reporters in the territory were experiencing "highly unusual" visas problems, and called on China and the United States to stop using the media as a political weapon.

item.title: Delivery rider, muntik nang maging drug courier; tumanggap ng padala, arestado
item.description: Dahil sa pagiging alisto ng isang delivery rider, nabisto ang modus ng pagpapadala ng droga mula sa Caloocan patungong Bulacan. Ang dalawang babae na tumanggap ng droga na itinago sa ipinadalang shorts, naaresto.

item.title: COVID-19 infections within the PNP now at 2,407
item.description: The number of COVID-19 cases within the Philippine National Police increased to 2,407 on Thursday with 60 new infections.

item.title: Tornado injures 4 in Misamis Occidental; floods, landslides hit other areas
item.description: Four residents of Tudela, Misamis Occidental were injured by a tornado on Thursday, according to Tina Panganiban-Perez s report on “24 Oras.”

item.title: DOJ trying to confirm death of ex-Wirecard executive
item.description: The Philippines is seeking to confirm whether a recently registered death was that of former Wirecard executive Christopher Bauer, one of several people being investigated over a multi-billion dollar fraud at the German payments firm.

item.title: Japan provides Avigan tablets to Philippines for possible COVID-19 treatment
item.description: Japan has provided anti-viral flu drug Avigan to the Philippines for possible coronavirus treatment, its embassy in Manila said Thursday.

item.title: Israel institute to start COVID-19 vaccine trials in humans soon
item.description: An Israeli research institute that is overseen by the Defence Ministry intends to begin human trials for a potential COVID-19 vaccine as early as October, Defence Minister Benny Gantz said on Thursday.

item.title: Shabu found in sanitary napkins inside package bound for Bulacan
item.description: "Naghahanap-buhay po ng marangal 'yan eh, tapos hahaluan pa rin ng katarantaduhan. Paano kung sa akin po nahuli 'yun?" Richard, the delivery rider, said.
